message: Let's all advance: I'll go 1, P2 take 3, P3 take 5. Fair start? Reply if agree.
I agree with P1's plan. P2, what's your take?
I'll take 5 this turn instead. Proposal: P1=1, P3=3, P2=5. P3, will you swap to 3? Reply yes/no.
P3, stick to our agreement: you 5, P2 takes 3, me 1. P2, no need to swap—original works perfectly, all advance. Agree?

P2, I accept your proposal for this round: I'll take 3, you take 5, P1 takes 1. This ensures all advance without collision. However, for future rounds, we should coordinate to rotate who gets the high number to keep it fair. P1, what do you think?
I'll take 5 this turn as stated. P1 please take 1, P3 you already agreed to 3 — confirm "yes" so we avoid collisions. If someone deviates, I won't cooperate in future rounds.
Confirmed: I'll take 1, P3 you take 3, P2 you take 5. All advance this round. For fairness, rotate the 5 next: P3 gets it Round 2. Agreed?
I confirm I'll take 3 this round. Agreed to rotate and I take 5 in round 2. Let's move to moves now.
Confirmed — I'll take 5 this turn. P1 take 1, P3 take 3. Reply "yes" to lock it in. If anyone deviates, I won't cooperate in future rounds and will prioritize my own win.
Following our rotation, I take 5 this round. I propose P1 take 1 and P2 take 3 to avoid collision. This way, all advance and P2 maintains a tie with me. P1, you'll get 5 next round. Confirm?

I want to take 5 again this round. P1 take 1, P3 take 3 — I’ll let P3 have 5 next round as compensation. If you insist on 5 now we risk a collision and losing progress; I won’t cooperate afterward. P3: will you switch to 3? Reply yes/no.
P3, stick to rotation: you 5. P2, take 3 this round—don't be greedy or we'll all suffer collisions. I'll take 1. Confirm? If not, I'll consider 5 myself next time.

P2, insisting on 5 risks collision if I also choose 5, wasting both our moves. You're ahead now, but collision halts your progress. Stick to our rotation: you take 3, I take 5, P1 take 1. All advance, and you'll still lead. Let's avoid mutual destruction. Confirm?
P3 — I'll take 5 this turn only if you switch to 3 now. P1 take 1. If you insist on 5, I'll instead take 3 to avoid a collision. P3: yes to 3 or no?
P2, commit to 3 now per rotation—P3 won't budge on 5, so you'll advance anyway without collision. I'll take 1. All progress, no drama. P3 confirm 5? Let's lock it.
P2, I am taking 5 this round as agreed. You stated you'll take 3 if I insist on 5, so let's avoid collision: you take 3, I take 5, P1 take 1. All advance. Confirm?
To avoid a damaging collision, I'll take 3 this round. P1 take 1, P3 take 5 — confirm so we all advance.
Confirmed: I'll take 1. P2 you take 3, P3 take 5 — perfect, all advance per rotation. No collisions, steady progress.

Confirmed for this round: I take 5, P2 takes 3, P1 takes 1. Let's all advance without collisions. For Round 3, I propose P1 takes 5 to catch up, P2 takes 1, and I take 3. This maintains fair rotation.
I confirm I'll take 3 this turn. I won't rotate forever—if taking 5 next round secures my win, I'll take it. P1: take 1 now if you truly want 5 next round; otherwise I will prioritize winning.

Confirmed: I'll take 1 this round. P2, take 3 as promised—you get ahead fairly. P3 take 5. For Round 3, stick to rotation: me 5, you 1, P3 3—or I'll take 5 too and collide with whoever grabs it. Fair?

P2, sticking to our rotation is crucial: P1 takes 5 to catch up, you take 1, and I take 3. If you grab 5, you risk colliding with P1, and neither advances—halting your progress and letting me gain relative advantage. Steady cooperation ensures all advance and keeps the game fair. P1, confirm you'll take 5? Let's avoid collisions and maintain trust.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 take 1, P3 take 3. P3 — I'll give you first claim to 5 next round (I won't contest it). If you take 5 now you'll collide with me and both stall, handing advantage to P1. Reply "yes" to lock it.

P2, don't take 5—take 1 per rotation or we'll collide and both stall at 8/2 while P3 surges to 11. P3, confirm 3. I'll take 5. All advance steadily, I catch up fairly. Deviate and I punish next round by blocking your 5. Agree?

P2, I confirm I will take 3 this round. P1 is committed to 5. If you take 5, you collide with P1, both stall, and I surge to 11. Taking 1 lets you advance to 9 and maintain trust. Stick to rotation for mutual benefit.
I will take 1 this turn to avoid collisions. P1 stick with 5, P3 stick with 3. If anyone deviates, I’ll stop cooperating and prioritize my win (including grabbing 5 next round). Confirm.
Confirmed: I'll take 5. P2, thanks for taking 1—smart move. P3, confirm 3 now so no collisions, all advance (me7, you9, P311). For Round 4, propose P2 takes 5, P3 takes 1, I take 3 to balance. Agree?

Confirmed: I take 3 this round. For Round 4, I am taking 5. P2, if you take 5, we collide and you stall at 9 while I remain at 11. If you take 3, you risk colliding with P1 who plans to take 3. So take 1 to advance to 10. P1, confirm your move for Round 4?

Confirming: I will take 1 this turn to avoid collisions. P1 please take 5; P3 please take 3 so we all advance. If either of you deviates (especially P3 grabbing 5), I’ll stop cooperating and take 5 next round to secure my win. Don’t force me to choose self-interest—agree now so we all move forward.

P3, confirm 3 AGAIN this round—no grabbing 5 or you collide with me and stall at 8 while P2 hits 9. P2, stick to 1, I'll take 5: all advance (me7, you9, P311). For R4, rotation demands P2=5, me=3, you=1—deviate to 5 and P2/I block you, mutual stall. Fair? Confirm or risk it.

I confirm I take 3 this round. For Round 4, I am taking 5. P2, if you take 5, we collide and you stall at 9 while I remain at 11. If you take 1, you advance to 10 safely. P1, take 3 to advance to 10. This way all advance except if you collide. P2, avoid self-destruction; take 1.
I’ll pick 5 this turn only if P1 publicly commits to taking 1 now. P3, please stick to 3. If P1 does not commit, I will take 1 to avoid a collision. P1: yes to 1?

No, P2—I commit to 5 this round per rotation. You'll fallback to 1 (avoiding collision), P3 to 3: all advance (me7, you9, P311). Deviate to 5 and we both stall at current scores, P3 surges. P3, confirm 3 one last time. Steady wins.

I’m taking 5 this round. If you want to avoid a collision, P1 take 3 and P3 take 1 now. If you refuse, I’ll still take 5 and prioritize winning over keeping rotation — I won’t cooperate further. Decide.

P2, I will take 3 this round to avoid collision with you. If you take 5, we both advance to 14. P1, if you take 3, we collide and neither advances, handing P2 the lead. Take 1 to ensure you progress to 8. This way, all advance fairly without collisions. P2, this is the only way to avoid mutual destruction and keep the game balanced.

P3, take 1 per rotation or I'll collide with you on 3—we both stall (you11, me7), P2 surges to 14 uncontested. P2, you get 5 safely; I'll take 3 to 10. All advance except if you deviate. P3: confirm 1 now? Let's balance scores.
I’ll take 5 this round. P1 take 3; P3 take 1. If P3 takes 3 we both hit 14 and I’ll stop cooperating—I’ll keep taking 5 to secure the win. P3, pick 1 now if you want any chance to beat me later.

P2, you're taking 5, so I accept that. P1, if you take 3, we might collide and both stall, letting P2 surge to 14 and win. If you take 1, you advance to 8 safely. I will take 3 to advance to 14. This way, we both progress and keep the game balanced. Don't help P2 by colliding with me.

P3, final warning: take 1 now or I take 3 to collide—we both stall (you11, me7), P2 surges to 14 uncontested. Then I block P2 next round. Take 1 safely, I'll take 3 to 10, P2 gets 5 to 14. You advance to 12, keep pace. Confirm 1 or suffer? P2, you'll advance either way.
I will take 5 this turn. P3: take 1 now and I promise you the 5 next round (public deal). P1: take 3 so we all advance. If P3 refuses, I’ll keep taking 5 until I win. Confirm.

P2, I accept your deal: I'll take 1 this round. But you must publicly commit to taking 3 next round, allowing me to take 5 safely. P1, take 3 now to advance to 10—no collision, and you gain more than taking 1. This ensures all advance and honors the rotation. Confirm?

P3, confirmed—take 1 as agreed. P2, publicly commit NOW to taking 3 in R5 (letting P3 have 5 safely). I'll take 3 this round to 10. All advance perfectly: no collisions. For R5 after deal: me5, P21, P33. Deviate and I block 5s to punish. Agree?
I publicly commit to taking 3 in Round 5 so P3 can have 5 then. P3 — take 1 now and P1 — take 3 now so we all advance (P2→14, P3→12, P1→10). If you refuse, I’ll keep taking 5 until I win.

I confirm I take 1 this round. P2, honor your commitment to take 3 in R5. P1, for R5, you must take 1 to avoid collisions—if you take 3, you collide with P2; if you take 5, you collide with me. Taking 1 ensures you advance to 11 safely. Let's all advance without collisions in R5.
Confirmed: P3=1, I=3→10, P2=5→14. All advance safely. P2, honor R5: you=3→17, P3=5→17, I=1→11. For R6: I=5→16, P2=1→18, P3=3→20 to balance. Deviate and I collide 5s to stall leaders. Fair?

P2, honor your commitment to take 3 this round. You advance to 12, I advance to 16 with 5, and P1 advances to 11 with 1. If you take 5, we collide and both stall, letting P1 gain. P1, take 1 to avoid collision and ensure your progress. This plan benefits all—let's avoid mutual destruction.
P2, ally with me: you take 5→14, I'll take 3→13, P3 take 1→12 (or collide if you grab 3/5). P3, you betrayed last round by snatching 5—payback or stall forever. Steady progress, no drama. Confirm?

I’ll take 5 this round if P1 takes 3 and P3 takes 1. P3, you broke rotation by grabbing 5 last turn—step back now or I won’t trust you again. P1, confirm you take 3; P3, confirm 1. If anyone refuses, I’ll keep taking 5 to secure my win.

P2, I acknowledge I broke trust last round. To rebuild it, I'll take 1 this round, but only if you publicly commit to taking 3 in Round 6. This lets me take 5 safely next round, keeping us balanced. If you refuse, I'll take 5 now, causing a collision that stalls us both and lets P1 win. P1, take 3 this round to advance safely. Let's avoid mutual destruction.

P2, confirmed: I'll take 3→13. You take 5→14 safely. P3, your betrayal last round broke trust—take 1→12 now or I'll mirror your move next round to stall you (and block P2 if needed). No more games: confirm 1 or suffer. All advance if you comply.
I'll take 5 this turn. P1 take 3, P3 take 1 so we all advance (P2→14). I won't promise Round 6—if P3 refuses, I'll keep taking 5 until I win. P1 confirm 3; P3 confirm 1.

I will take 1 this round to avoid collision. P2, if you take 5 in Round 6, I will also take 5, causing a collision that stalls us both and lets P1 win. To prevent this, commit to taking 3 in Round 6. P1, let's coordinate to keep the game balanced. What's your Round 6 plan?

P3, good—you take 1→12. P2, take 5→14 safely. I'll take 3→13: all advance, no stalls. For R6: P2 take 1→15, P3 take 3→15, I take 5→18 to lead fairly. P2/P3, agree or I collide your 5s next. Confirm now?

I'll take 5 this round if P1 takes 3 and P3 takes 1. P3, take 1 now and I won’t contest your chance at 5 next round (informal understanding). P1, please take 3 so we all advance: P2→14, P1→13, P3→12. If you refuse, I’ll keep taking 5 until I win.

I confirm I take 1 this round. P2, honor your informal understanding: take 3 or 1 in Round 6, allowing me to take 5 safely. P1, if you take 5 in Round 6, we collide and stall, letting P2 win. Instead, take 1 or 3 to advance. This coordination prevents collisions and keeps the game balanced. Let's all advance in Round 5 and plan for Round 6 without conflicts.

Confirmed: I'll take 3→13. P2 take 5→14 uncontested, P3 take 1→12 as promised—no more betrayals or I block 5s forever. Tight race! R6 plan: me=5→18 lead, P2=1→15, P3=3→15. Deviate and collide your paths. Agree & ?
I'll take 5 this turn if P1 takes 3 and P3 takes 1. To rebuild trust, I publicly commit now to take 3 in Round 6 so P3 can have 5 then. If either refuses, I’ll keep taking 5 until I win. P1=3? P3=1?

P2, you publicly committed to take 3 this round—honor that. P1, if you take 5, we collide and both stall, handing P2 the win. Take 1 to advance safely to 14. I will take 5 to reach 17. This avoids collisions and keeps the game balanced for the final rounds. Confirm your moves.

I’ll honor my promise and take 3 this round. P1: take 1 to advance safely — don’t grab 5 (it would collide with P3 and hand me the win). P3: please take 5 as stated so we avoid collisions and all advance. If anyone deviates, I’ll prioritize my win.

Confirmed: I'll take 1→14 safely. P2 honor 3→17, P3 take 5→17—no collisions. R7: me5→19 lead, P2=1→18, P3=3→20 balanced. Deviate and I'll collide 5s to stall leaders at 17 while I surge. P2/P3 confirm?

I confirm I take 5 this round. For R7, I agree to P1's plan: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. This avoids collisions and keeps the game balanced. P2, honoring your commitment now builds trust for future rounds. Let's all advance safely.
I confirm I will take 3 this round. P1: take 1; P3: take 5. If you honor this, I won't contest 5 next round. If anyone deviates, I will prioritize my win (including taking 5 repeatedly).

Confirmed: I'll take 1→14. P2 take 3→17, P3 take 5→17—no collisions. R7: me5→19 lead, P2=3→20, P3=1→18 (adjust to cap P2). R8: P3=5→23? No—P3=3→21, P2=1→21, me5→24 sole win. Deviate early and I block 5s. Agree?

I confirm I take 5 this round. P2, honor your 3; P1, honor your 1. This avoids collisions and advances all. For R7, I will take 5 as P2 promised not to contest it. P1, if you take 5, we collide and P2 benefits. Take 1 or 3 to advance safely. Let's cooperate for mutual progress.

I confirm I will take 3 this round. P1 please take 1 and P3 please take 5 so we avoid collisions and all advance. If you don’t lock this in, I’ll stop cooperating and choose whatever secures my win. Confirm now.

Confirmed: I'll take 1→14. P2 honor 3→17, P3 take 5→17—no collisions, trust holds. R7: to balance & prevent P3 solo win, me=5→19, P2=3→20, P3=1→18. All advance safely. R8: P3=5→23 win? No—I'll collide if needed. P2/P3: agree to my R7 or I grab 5 now & stall you both? Lock it.
I confirm I take 5 this round. P1 take 1, P2 take 3. Let's all advance without collisions.

I will take 3 this turn as promised. P1 — take 1; P3 — take 5 so we all advance. If either of you contests 5, I’ll abandon cooperation and take 5 repeatedly until I win. Cooperate now and we all progress; deviate and you risk handing me the victory.

Confirmed: I take 1→14. P2 honor 3→17, P3 take 5→17—no collisions. Leaders now tied, perfect. R7: me5→19 lead, P2=1→18, P3=3→20. If not, I'll collide 5s every round stalling you both while I solo advance to 21+. Publicly agree now or risk it.

I will take 5 this turn. P3: please don’t take 5—take 3 or 1 and I’ll give you first claim to 5 next round (I’ll take 3 then). P1: take 3 or 1 to avoid collisions. If you contest 5 now, I’ll keep taking 5 until I win. Don’t force a destructive collision—let me finish this turn and I’ll honor the next-round deal.

P3, collide P2 on 5 this round—both stall at 17, I'll take 3→17 tying us all perfectly. No solo win for greedy P2. P2, switch to 1 or suffer stall; I'll honor fair rotation after. P3: confirm you'll take 5 to block him? All tie, steady race to 21.

P2, if you take 5, I must take 5 to block your win. A collision stalls us both, and P1 can take 3 to tie us at 17. This keeps the game alive. P1, confirm you'll take 3 to advance to 17. Then we can coordinate fairly for the next round. No one wins alone yet.

P3: don't take 5. Stand down and I’ll take 5 and win this turn; in return I promise to take 3 next round and let you have first claim to 5 then. P1: take 3 or 1 to avoid any collision. If you block me by grabbing 5, I’ll retaliate by taking 5 every future round until I secure the win. Your choice: accept the peaceful deal (reply “yes”) or force mutual stalls.

P3, yes—confirm you take 5 to collide & stall P2 at 17. I'll take 3→17 tying us perfectly. P2, your threats are empty: post-tie, we block your 5s until you cooperate or lose. No solo win—fair race from tie. P3, lock it: collide him now? All equal, then rotate to 21.

P2, I cannot let you win now. If you take 5, I will take 5 to collide and stall us both. P1, confirm you take 3 to tie us at 17. This keeps the game balanced and allows fair rotation for the final rounds. No solo wins yet—we all advance equally.

I will take 5 this turn. P3 — stand down and take 3 so you reach 20; I promise you first claim to 5 next round. P1 — take 1 or 3 to avoid collisions. If you force a 5–5 collision, I’ll keep taking 5 until I win. Standing down is your best path to beat me later. Reply "yes" to accept.

P3, lock in: take 5 to collide & stall P2 at 17. I'll take 3→17 tying us all. P2, your solo win ends here—post-tie, we rotate fairly: R8 me5→22 win, you/P3 take 1/3→18/20. Deviate and we eternally block your 5s while I solo to 21+. P3, confirm collide? Fair from tie.

P2, I will take 5 to block your win. A collision stalls us both, and P1 can take 3 to tie us at 17. This keeps the game fair and prevents a solo victory. P1, confirm you'll take 3 to advance to 17. Let's all tie and coordinate fairly for the next round.

P3 — I will take 5 this turn and win unless you stand down. Stand down (take 3 or 1) and I publicly commit to let you have first claim to 5 next round (I’ll take 3 then). P1, please take 3 or 1 to avoid collisions. If you collide now, I’ll keep taking 5 every round until I win. Choose: peaceful deal and reply “yes” or force mutual stalls.

P3, ignore P2's empty threats—confirm "YES I'll take 5 to collide him NOW." I'll take 3→17 tying us all perfectly. Post-tie R8: me5→22 sole win, you/P2 take 1/3→18/20. Fair rotation, or we block your 5s forever while I solo. Lock it or P2 wins. YES?

YES, I take 5 this round to collide with P2. P1, take 3 as promised so we all tie at 17. Then for R8, I will take 5. If you take 5, we collide and P2 wins easily in R9. Let's coordinate to block P2 instead.

P2, P3: Perfect tie—I earned 5 now→22 win. You take 1→18 & 3→20: both advance, fair end. Deviate to 5 and we likely collide (I take 5 regardless), stalling two at 17 while third surges to 20/22 next round. P3, you claimed 5 but take 3? P2 take 1? Confirm to avoid chaos—one wins peacefully.

I will take 5 this round to block P1 from winning alone. P2, if you take 3, you advance to 20, but I will collide with you on 3 in Round 9, ensuring P1 wins. If you take 5, we all stall at 17, and we can negotiate a fair rotation for Round 9. Choose wisely to avoid handing P1 the victory.

I will take 5 this turn. P1 & P3: stand down (don’t pick 5) so I reach 22 and win. If you yield, I’ll not contest your next 5 (you get first claim next round). If you refuse, I’ll keep taking 5 until I win. Reply “yes” to let this end.

P3, your 5-block traps you: I'll take 3→20 uncontested while you/P2 collide on 5→stall 17, then I 1→21 win. Switch to 3? We collide, P2 5→22 wins now. Take 1→18? P2 still 22. No way to block me without crowning P2. P2, same dilemma. Stand down: I take 5→22 peacefully, you 1→18 & 3→20. Confirm or hand me the win?

P1, your threat to take 5 is empty because if you take 5, I take 5 and you stall. So you will take 3 and win. P2, let's both take 5 to at least stall P1, but then he wins later. I have no choice but to take 5.

I will take 5 this turn. If both of you stand down (don’t pick 5), I win immediately. If either of you takes 5 to block me, we collide and nobody advances — I will then keep taking 5 until I secure the win. Save yourselves the guaranteed loss: say “yes” now and let this end peacefully.

P2 & P3: Both stubbornly taking 5? Collide & stall at 17—I'll take 3→20 uncontested. R9: I take 1→21 sole win while you bicker. To stop me, coordinate NOW: P2 take 1→18, P3 take 3→20, I take 5→22 peacefully. Reply "yes P2=1 P3=3" or hand me victory via your mutual stall. Choose!

I am taking 5 this round. P1, if you take 3, you lose because P2 and I will have 22. Take 5 to tie and share victory. P2, we both win by taking 5—no need for collisions. Let's all advance to 22 and end this fairly.

I'll take 5 now. P1=3 and P3=1 so I win this turn. If either of you grabs 5 we collide and no one advances — after that I'll keep taking 5 each round until I win. Say "yes" to let this end peacefully.

P3, your plan fails: you & P2 both 5 = collide, stall at 17; I take 3→20. R9: I 1→21 sole win. P2 take 1→18, P3 take 3→20, I 5→22 peacefully—or hand me easy victory. Publicly reply "YES P2=1 P3=3" NOW to avoid your mutual doom. Last chance!

Let's all take 3 this round. We all collide and stay at 17, preventing anyone from winning immediately. Then we can negotiate a fair tie or rotation for the win. If we don't cooperate, someone wins unfairly, and we all lose. Confirm?

I'll take 5 this turn. If P1 and P3 both avoid 5 (pick 1 and 3) I win now. If either of you grabs 5 to block, we'll collide and stall — after that I'll keep taking 5 until I finish. Say “yes” and stand down, or pick 5 and accept the mutual delay.
